abstract.p: Barath Nagarajan letter says United States should sign treaty setting up international criminal court as way to enforce uniform international human rights standards

block.p: The United States should sign the treaty setting up an international criminal court (World Briefing item, Sept. 14). An international criminal court is the only way to enforce uniform international human rights standards.

The United States should sign the treaty setting up an international criminal court (World Briefing item, Sept. 14). An international criminal court is the only way to enforce uniform international human rights standards.

Signing it would be part of a logical progression: the United States has already signed the Universal Declaration on Human Rights and the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights, as well as the Geneva Conventions, which are the basis for those treaties.

Government officials of countries that violate human rights must be held accountable. The United States has concerns about national sovereignty, but by not signing the treaty we make our country look as if it is trying to evade human rights laws.
